abstract: C-erbB2/HER2 serves as an important prognostic and predictive biomarker in various human tumors, especially in breast cancer, whereas its role in human intracranial tumors is more uncertain. We therefore performed a search in PubMed to get an update. This literature review comprises immunohistochemical studies on the clinical significance of c-erbB2/HER2 overexpression in gliomas, medulloblastomas, and meningiomas. In general, the findings were discrepant with regard to correlations between overexpression, tumor grade, and prognosis. Use of various antibodies may be a contributing factor to these discrepancies. Standardization of the immunohistochemical procedures is a relevant topic for discussion.
title: C-erbB2/HER2 in human gliomas, medulloblastomas, and meningiomas: a minireview.
